what: Easily make nice APA tables — nice_table
title: Easily make nice APA tables — nice_table
text: Make nice APA tables easily wrapper around flextable package sensical defaults automatic formatting features.

title: Easily make nice APA tables — nice_table
code: nice_table(   data,   highlight = FALSE,   stars = TRUE,   italics,   col.format.p,   col.format.r,   col.format.ci,   format.custom,   col.format.custom,   width = NULL,   spacing = 2,   broom = NULL,   report = NULL,   short = FALSE,   title,   note,   separate.header )

title: Easily make nice APA tables — nice_table
text: data data frame, converted flextable. data frame duplicate column names. highlight Highlight rows statistically significant results? Requires column named "p" containing p-values. Can either accept logical (TRUE/FALSE) numeric value custom critical p-value threshold (e.g., 0.10 0.001). stars Logical. Whether add asterisks significant p values. italics columns headers italic? Useful column names italic picked automatically function. Select numerical range, e.g., 1:3. col.format.p Applies p-value formatting columns named "p" (example data frame full p-values, also possible one column named "p"). Select numerical range, e.g., 1:3. col.format.r Applies r-value formatting columns named "r" (example data frame full r-values, also possible one column named "r"). Select numerical range, e.g., 1:3. col.format.ci Applies 95% confidence interval formatting selected columns (e.g., reporting one interval). format.custom Applies custom formatting columns selected via col.format.custom argument. useful one wants custom formatting p- r-values. can also used transform (e.g., multiply) certain values print specific symbol along values instance. col.format.custom columns apply custom function . Select numerical range, e.g., 1:3. width Width table, percentage total width, exported e.g., Word. full width, use width = 1. spacing Spacing rows (1 = single space, 2 = double space) broom providing tidy table produced broom package, model type use one wants automatic formatting (options "t.test", "lm", "cor.test", "wilcox.test"). report providing object produced report package, model type use one wants automatic formatting (options "t.test", "lm", "cor.test"). short Logical. Whether return abbreviated version tables made report package. title Optional, add table header, desired. note Optional, add one table footnote (APA note), desired. separate.header Logical, whether separate headers based name delimiters (.e., periods ".").

title: Obtain variance per group — nice_var
text: Obtain variance per group well check rule thumb one group variance four times bigger groups. Variance ratio calculated Max / Min.

title: Obtain variance per group — nice_var
code: nice_var(data, variable, group, criteria = 4)

title: Obtain variance per group — nice_var
text: data data frame variable dependent variable plotted. group group plot variable. criteria Desired threshold one wants something different four times variance.

title: Obtain variance per group — nice_var
text: dataframe, values selected variables group, max variance ratio (maximum variance divided minimum variance), selected decision criterion, whether data considered heteroscedastic according decision criterion.

title: Obtain variance per group — nice_var
code: # Make the basic table nice_var(   data = iris,   variable = "Sepal.Length",   group = "Species" ) #>        Species Setosa Versicolor Virginica Variance.ratio Criteria #> 1 Sepal.Length  0.124      0.266     0.404            3.3        4 #>   Heteroscedastic #> 1           FALSE  # Try on multiple variables nice_var(   data = iris,   variable = names(iris[1:4]),   group = "Species" ) #>        Species Setosa Versicolor Virginica Variance.ratio Criteria #> 1 Sepal.Length  0.124      0.266     0.404            3.3        4 #> 2  Sepal.Width  0.144      0.098     0.104            1.5        4 #> 3 Petal.Length  0.030      0.221     0.305           10.2        4 #> 4  Petal.Width  0.011      0.039     0.075            6.8        4 #>   Heteroscedastic #> 1           FALSE #> 2           FALSE #> 3            TRUE #> 4            TRUE

title: Attempt to visualize variance per group — nice_varplot
text: data data frame variable dependent variable plotted. group group plot variable. colours Desired colours plot, desired. groups.labels label groups. grid Logical, whether keep default background grid . APA style suggests using grid background, though case may find useful easily estimate slopes different groups. shapiro Logical, whether include p-value Shapiro-Wilk test plot. ytitle optional y-axis label, desired.

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
text: Make nice violin plots easily 95% (possibly bootstrapped) confidence intervals.

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
code: nice_violin(   data,   response,   group = NULL,   boot = FALSE,   bootstraps = 2000,   colours,   xlabels = NULL,   ytitle = response,   xtitle = NULL,   has.ylabels = TRUE,   has.xlabels = TRUE,   comp1 = 1,   comp2 = 2,   signif_annotation = NULL,   signif_yposition = NULL,   signif_xmin = NULL,   signif_xmax = NULL,   ymin,   ymax,   yby = 1,   CIcap.width = 0.1,   obs = FALSE,   alpha = 1,   border.colour = "black",   border.size = 2,   has.d = FALSE,   d.x = mean(c(comp1, comp2)) * 1.1,   d.y = mean(data[[response]]) * 1.3,   groups.order = "none",   xlabels.angle = 0 )

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
text: data data frame. response dependent variable plotted. group group plot variable. boot Logical, whether use bootstrapping confidence interval . bootstraps many bootstraps use. colours Desired colours plot, desired. xlabels individual group labels x-axis. ytitle optional y-axis label, desired. xtitle optional x-axis label, desired. .ylabels Logical, whether x-axis labels . .xlabels Logical, whether y-axis labels . comp1 first unit pairwise comparison, goal compare two groups. Automatically displays *, **, *** depending significance difference. Can take either numeric value (based group number) name group directly. Must provided along argument comp2. comp2 second unit pairwise comparison, goal compare two groups. Automatically displays "", "", "" depending significance difference. Can take either numeric value (based group number) name group directly. Must provided along argument comp1. signif_annotation Manually provide required annotations/numbers stars (character strings). Useful automatic pairwise comparison annotation work expected, yet one wants one pairwise comparison. Must provided along arguments signif_yposition, signif_xmin, signif_xmax. signif_yposition Manually provide vertical position annotations/stars, based y-scale. signif_xmin Manually provide first part horizontal position annotations/stars (start left-sided bracket), based x-scale. signif_xmax Manually provide second part horizontal position annotations/stars (end right-sided bracket), based x-scale. ymin minimum score y-axis scale. ymax maximum score y-axis scale. yby much increase "tick" y-axis scale. CIcap.width width confidence interval cap. obs Logical, whether plot individual observations . type plotting can also specified, either "dotplot" (obs = TRUE backward compatibility) "jitter", useful lot observations. alpha transparency plot. border.colour colour violins border. border.size size violins border. .d Whether display d-value. d.x x-axis coordinates d-value. d.y y-axis coordinates d-value. groups.order order group factor levels x-axis. Either "increasing" "decreasing", order based value variable y axis, "string.length", order shortest longest string (useful working long string names). "Defaults "none". xlabels.angle much tilt labels x-axis. Useful working long string names. "Defaults 0.

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
text: violin plot class ggplot, group.

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
text: Using boot = TRUE uses bootstrapping (confidence intervals ) BCa method, using rcompanion_groupwiseMean function. easystats equivalent, see: see::geom_violindot().

title: Easy violin plots — nice_violin
code: # Make the basic plot nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   response = "len" )  # \donttest{ # Save a high-resolution image file to specified directory ggplot2::ggsave("niceviolinplothere.pdf", width = 7,   height = 7, unit = "in", dpi = 300 ) # change for your own desired path # Change x- and y- axes labels nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   ytitle = "Length of Tooth",   xtitle = "Vitamin C Dosage" )   # See difference between two groups nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   comp1 = "0.5",   comp2 = "2" )   nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   comp1 = 2,   comp2 = 3 )   # Compare all three groups nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   signif_annotation = c("*", "**", "***"),   # manually enter the number of stars   signif_yposition = c(30, 35, 40),   # What height (y) should the stars appear   signif_xmin = c(1, 2, 1),   # Where should the left-sided brackets start (x)   signif_xmax = c(2, 3, 3) )  # Where should the right-sided brackets end (x)  # Set the colours manually nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   colours = c("darkseagreen", "cadetblue", "darkslateblue") )   # Changing the names of the x-axis labels nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   xlabels = c("Low", "Medium", "High") )   # Removing the x-axis or y-axis titles nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   ytitle = NULL,   xtitle = NULL )   # Removing the x-axis or y-axis labels (for whatever purpose) nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   has.ylabels = FALSE,   has.xlabels = FALSE )   # Set y-scale manually nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   ymin = 5,   ymax = 35,   yby = 5 ) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_ydensity()`).   # Plotting individual observations nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   obs = TRUE ) #> Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with #> `binwidth`.   # Micro-customizations nice_violin(   data = ToothGrowth,   group = "dose",   response = "len",   CIcap.width = 0,   alpha = .70,   border.size = 1,   border.colour = "white",   comp1 = 1,   comp2 = 2,   has.d = TRUE )  # }

what: Interpolate the Inclusion of the Other in the Self Scale — overlap_circle
title: Interpolate the Inclusion of the Other in the Self Scale — overlap_circle
text: Interpolating Inclusion Self Scale (IOS; self-merging) easily. user provides IOS score, 1 7, function provide percentage actual area overlap two circles (.e., linear overlap), possible say, e.g., experimental group 1 average overlap X% person, whereas experimental group 2 average overlap X% person.

title: Interpolate the Inclusion of the Other in the Self Scale — overlap_circle
text: plot class gList, displaying overlapping circles relative selected score.

title: Interpolate the Inclusion of the Other in the Self Scale — overlap_circle

title: Interpolate the Inclusion of the Other in the Self Scale — overlap_circle
code: # Score of 1 (0% overlap) overlap_circle(1)   # Score of 3.5 (25% overlap) overlap_circle(3.5)   # Score of 6.84 (81.8% overlap) overlap_circle(6.84)   # Changing labels overlap_circle(3.12, categories = c("Humans", "Animals"))   # \donttest{ # Saving to file (PDF or PNG) plot <- overlap_circle(3.5)  ggplot2::ggsave(plot,   file = tempfile(fileext = ".pdf"), width = 7,   height = 7, unit = "in", dpi = 300 ) # Change for your own desired path # }

what: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time
title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time
text: Make nice scatter plots multiple times (T1, T2, T3) easily.

title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time
code: plot_means_over_time(   data,   response,   group,   groups.order = "none",   error_bars = TRUE,   ytitle = NULL,   legend.title = "",   significance_stars,   significance_stars_x,   significance_stars_y,   significance_bars_x,   print_table = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time
text: data data frame. response dependent variable plotted (e.g., c("variable_T1", "variable_T2", "variable_T3"), etc.). group group plot variable groups.order Specifies desired display order groups legend. Either provide levels directly, string: "increasing" "decreasing", order based average value variable y axis, "string.length", order shortest longest string (useful working long string names). "Defaults "none". error_bars Logical, whether include 95% confidence intervals means. ytitle optional x-axis label, desired. NULL, take variable name first variable response, keep part string underscore period. legend.title desired legend title. significance_stars Vetor significance stars display plot (e.g,. c("*", "**", "***")). significance_stars_x Vector x-axis significance stars appear plot (e.g., c(2.2, 3.2, 4.2)). significance_stars_y Vector y-axis significance stars appear plot. logic different previous arguments. Rather providing actual coordinates, provide list object structure group 1, group 2, time comparison, e.g., list(c("group1", "group2", time = 2), c("group1", "group3", time = 3), c("group2", "group3", time = 4)). significance_bars_x Vector x-axis vertical significance bars appear plot (e.g., c(2:4)). print_table Logical, whether also print computed table. verbose Logical, whether also print note regarding meaning error bars.

title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time

title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time
text: Error bars calculated using method Morey (2008) Rmisc::summarySEwithin(), raw means plotted instead normed means. information, visit: http://www.cookbook-r.com/Graphs/Plotting_means_and_error_bars_(ggplot2).

title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time

title: Easy scatter plots over multiple times (T1, T2, T3) — plot_means_over_time
code: data <- mtcars names(data)[6:3] <- paste0("T", 1:4, "_var") plot_means_over_time(   data = data,   response = names(data)[6:3],   group = "cyl",   groups.order = "decreasing" )   # Add significance stars/bars plot_means_over_time(   data = data,   response = names(data)[6:3],   group = "cyl",   significance_bars_x = c(3.15, 4.15),   significance_stars = c("*", "***"),   significance_stars_x = c(3.25, 4.5),   significance_stars_y = list(     c("4", "8", time = 3),     c("4", "8", time = 4)   ) )  # significance_stars_y: List with structure: list(c("group1", "group2", time))

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: Get group means bootstrapped effect sizes rcompanion::groupwiseMean function. function taken separately package dependency failing upon install current package. original documentation: "Calculates means confidence intervals groups." : https://rcompanion.org/handbook/C_03.html "routine use, recommend using bootstrapped confidence intervals, particularly BCa percentile methods (...) default, function reports confidence intervals traditional method."

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
code: rcompanion_groupwiseMean(   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   var = NULL,   group = NULL,   trim = 0,   na.rm = FALSE,   conf = 0.95,   R = 5000,   boot = FALSE,   traditional = TRUE,   normal = FALSE,   basic = FALSE,   percentile = FALSE,   bca = FALSE,   digits = 3,   ... )

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: formula formula indicating measurement variable grouping variables. e.g. y ~ x1 + x2. data data frame use. var measurement variable use. name double quotes. group grouping variable use. name double quotes. Multiple names listed vector. (See example.) trim proportion observations trimmed end values mean calculated. (mean()) na.rm TRUE, NA values removed calculations. (mean()) conf confidence interval use. R number bootstrap replicates use bootstrapped statistics. boot TRUE, includes mean bootstrapped means. can used estimate mean group. traditional TRUE, includes traditional confidence intervals group means, using t-distribution. trim 0, traditional confidence interval produce NA. Likewise, NA values removed, traditional confidence interval produce NA. normal TRUE, includes normal confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See {boot::boot.ci}. basic TRUE, includes basic confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See {boot::boot.ci}. percentile TRUE, includes percentile confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See {boot::boot.ci}. bca TRUE, includes BCa confidence intervals group means bootstrap. See {boot::boot.ci}. digits number significant figures use output. ... arguments passed boot function.

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: data frame requested statistics group.

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: input include either formula data; data, var, group. (See examples).
code: Results for ungrouped (one-sample) data can be obtained by either      setting the right side of the formula to 1, e.g.  y ~ 1, or by      setting \code{group=NULL} when using \code{var}.

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: parsing formula simplistic. first variable left side used measurement variable.  variables right side used grouping variables.
code: In general, it is advisable to handle \code{NA} values before      using this function.      With some options, the function may not handle missing values well,      or in the manner desired by the user.      In particular, if \code{bca=TRUE} and there are \code{NA} values,      the function may fail.       For a traditional method to calculate confidence intervals      on trimmed means,      see Rand Wilcox, Introduction to Robust Estimation and      Hypothesis Testing.

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: https://rcompanion.org/handbook/C_03.html

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
text: Salvatore Mangiafico, mangiafico@njaes.rutgers.edu

title: Get group means and CIs (rcompanion::groupwiseMean) — rcompanion_groupwiseMean
code: # \donttest{ ### Example with formula notation data(mtcars) rcompanion_groupwiseMean(mpg ~ factor(cyl),   data         = mtcars,   traditional  = FALSE,   percentile   = TRUE ) #>   cyl  n Mean Conf.level Percentile.lower Percentile.upper #> 1   4 11 26.7       0.95             24.1             29.1 #> 2   6  7 19.7       0.95             18.7             20.7 #> 3   8 14 15.1       0.95             13.7             16.4  # Example with variable notation data(mtcars) rcompanion_groupwiseMean(   data = mtcars,   var = "mpg",   group = c("cyl", "am"),   traditional = FALSE,   percentile = TRUE ) #>   cyl am  n Mean Conf.level Percentile.lower Percentile.upper #> 1   4  0  3 22.9       0.95             21.5             24.4 #> 2   4  1  8 28.1       0.95             25.0             30.9 #> 3   6  0  4 19.1       0.95             18.0             20.6 #> 4   6  1  3 20.6       0.95             19.7             21.0 #> 5   8  0 12 15.0       0.95             13.5             16.5 #> 6   8  1  2 15.4       0.95             15.0             15.8 # }

what: rempsyc: Convenience Functions for Psychology — rempsyc-package

title: rempsyc 0.1.8

title: rempsyc 0.1.8

title: rempsyc 0.1.8

title: rempsyc 0.1.7
text: now converts sigma unicode counterpart (“3C3”) “z” “Z” now formatted two digits instead zero digits comply Wald Z statistics SEM (lavaan lavaanExtra) now supports conversion “CI_lower_B” “CI_upper_B” columns “95% CI (b*)“. nice_t_test: argument warning becomes verbose align packages.

title: rempsyc 0.1.7
text: Breaking news: APA 7th edition actually advises using beta represent standardized coefficients, suggests instead use lowercase italic b followed asterisk: b*. rempsyc follow APA recommendation going forward.

title: rempsyc 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-13 CRAN submission

title: rempsyc 0.1.6
text: nice_varplot: removed redundant legend

title: rempsyc 0.1.6
text: Corrected bug data argument contained character variables checking whether variables standardized.

title: rempsyc 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-19 CRAN submission

title: rempsyc 0.1.5
text: Now automatically attempts convert objects (e.g., emmGrid) dataframe save users headache. Now automatically converts column name “t.ratio” “t”. get_dep_version: various improvements, now robust

title: rempsyc 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-07-20 CRAN submission

title: rempsyc 0.1.4
text: nice_table: fix bug providing table one report::report object made Wilcoxon tests.

title: rempsyc 0.1.4
text: nice_lm_contrasts nice_contrasts: Code simplified now supports 3 groups, easystats’ modelbased package.

title: rempsyc 0.1.4
text: nice_assumptions: p values shapiro.test() defined vectors length 3 5000 thus throwing error cases. nice_assumptions now checks sample size returns NA samples outside range (#17, @sjewo).

title: rempsyc 0.1.4
text: install_if_not_installed: install specified packages installed. get_dep_version: checks required version specific package dependency looking specified package’s DESCRIPTION file directly. best_duplicate: now supports keep.rows argument, add column containing original rows. overlap_circle: now support two scoring methods: “percentage” (1 100), “direct” (must provide three values circle 1, overlapping area, circle 2).

title: rempsyc 0.1.4
text: Added tests functions Accordingly, updated code stop using deprecated functions packages (dplyr ggplot2).

title: rempsyc 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-20 CRAN resubmission

title: rempsyc 0.1.3
text: Fixed bug check_installed required package version specified correctly. way install dependencies now provided README file. Contribution Guidelines now available.

title: rempsyc 0.1.3
text: nice_scatter: groups.order now also allows automatic grouping based value response variable (one desired levels, “increasing”, “decreasing”, “string.length”), consistency nice_violin. nice_violin: order.groups argument renames groups.order consistency nice_scatter.

title: rempsyc 0.1.3
text: fix bug whereas group legend lost even using .legend = TRUE. .legend now defaults TRUE using group argument. New argument method, choices "lm" (default) "loess".

title: rempsyc 0.1.3
text: argument obs, two new choices: "dotplot" (obs = TRUE backward compatibility) "jitter", useful lot observations. Add new argument order.groups, order group factor levels based value “response” variable, string lengths group names (factor levels). Defaults “none” avoid changing previous behaviour. Add new argument xlabels.angle, tilt labels x-axis (useful working long string names).

title: rempsyc 0.1.3
text: nice_table: Correct beta rounding.

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-20 CRAN resubmission nice_table: Readd leading zero beta.

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: Now capitalize fit indices better integration package {lavaanExtra}. Simplification internal coding column formatting, e.g., columns names close equivalents, "pvalue" "p.value", now automatically converted "p" (similar others "chisq" "chi2", conf.low CI_low CI_lower, etc.), proper formatting.

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: nice_table: requested leading zero omitted beta values (since rarely goes beyond 1), now case (although note edge cases can go beyond 1, may indicate problems model, high multicollinearity).

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: format_r: now convert NA values “” instead “NA”; useful using col.format.r argument nice_table correlation matrices. nice_table: CFI, TLI, RMSEA, SRMR now omit leading zero usually greater one.

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: Fix bug checking column names (functions). Fix bug nice_violin accept NULL group argument (similar problem corrected version 0.1.1.4). Also changed order argument, response second, group third, since group becomes optional (consistent similar functions). Fix bug citation("rempsyc").

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: nice_lm nice_lm_slopes: better error messages wrong object type provided.

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: Fix newly introduced bug whereas nice_normality, nice_density, nice_qq work without group argument.

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: nice_table format_p: Now support logical stars argument add significance stars (defaults TRUE nice_table FALSE format_p).

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: nice_table: pointed , order align APA rules regarding tables, first column centered, left-aligned. corrected. nice_lm nice_lm_slopes: Now attempt automatically detect whether variables standardized, , sets b.label = "B" automatically. nice_lm, nice_lm_slopes, nice_mod nice_slopes: argument b.label becomes deprecated favour new standardize argument, defaults FALSE first two (likely desired result) TRUE last two (models probably already specified desired, want refit unless required).

title: rempsyc 0.1.2
text: Now produces clearer error messages specifying columns don’t exist, across functions. sr2 function now removed.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-06 CRAN resubmission!

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: nice_assumptions: now supports list objects, print interpretation message anymore since available documentation. nice_var: now supports list objects.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: nice_violin nice_contrasts: Now correctly handle missing values. New function! nice_lm_contrasts, handle complex contrast models involving e.g., interactions variables (similar nice_contrasts).

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: footnote argument renamed simply note since called APA table language. Fixed bug whereas note/footnote added extra empty invisible row end. Reduced cyclomatic complexity internally (swapped statements functions) dramatically (85 2). Default effect size changed regular Cohen’s d, robust Cohen’s d (effects) can now specified effect.type argument.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: Following easystats’s policy minimal reliance external dependencies, attempt change packages hard soft dependencies: flextable, effectsize, performance, insight, methods. left basic blocks coding: dplyr rlang. flextable, breaking change saving tables, since now need specify flextable::save_as_docx. However, change makes sense (1) used flextable one function, (2) users rely rempsyc plots don’t use tables, (3) consistent saving ggplot2 plots already, (4) also gives credit flextable package, powerhouse produces tables hood. nice_violin now provides informative error messages response group variables misspelled.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: nice_lm, nice_mod, nice_lm_slopes, nice_slopes now use “two.sided” alternative sr2 effect size confidence interval, facilitate interpretation accordance current norms psychology.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: Since easystats added new function calculate sr2, effectsize::r2_semipartial, rempsyc now relies function. First, advantage also providing confidence interval sr2. Second, also fixes bug using factors lm models introduced switching car::Anova manual calculation via formula interface. Accordingly, rempsyc::sr2 becomes deprecated removed completely next major version, please use effectsize::r2_semipartial. nice_mod nice_lm_slopes now use nice_lm internally reduce code redundancy shorten code base (nice_slopes uses nice_lm_slopes internally). align package dependencies, rempsyc now requires R >= 3.6 nice_reverse loses warning parameter, warning seems unnecessary (annoying ), given relevant information available documentation.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: nice_table now keeps first occurrence repeated (duplicated) dependent variables, merges (centers). works column called “Dependent Variables”. columns named “Predictor” “Term”, now also converts colons “:” multiplication symbol, “×”. outliers_plot changes name plot_outliers, consistent verb naming approach.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: nice_varplot nice_var: Now ignores missing values calculating variance.

title: rempsyc 0.1.1
text: New function visualize outliers: outliers_plot, generates violin scatter plot (dot plot) adds lines +/- 3 MAD (SD, based selected method). Importantly, supports plotting group. nice_violin: point time, supported single group (group), feature lost point. now back.

Underlying code also simplified. Finally, bug fixed whereas function used bootstrapping even boot set FALSE.

title: rempsyc 0.0.6

text: cormatrix_excel: corrected values small, medium, large correlations (0.0-0.3: small; 0.3-0.6: medium; 0.6-1.0: large 0.0-0.2: small; 0.2-0.4: medium; 0.4-1.0: large).

title: rempsyc 0.0.6
text: Corrected spelling code devtools::spell_check() Restyled code according tidyverse guidelines styler::style_pkg() nice_table: greatly improved APA title feature thanks @Buedenbender (shout-package datscience function flex_table1 improvement based!)

title: rempsyc 0.0.6
text: nice_table: added new argument, separate.header, logical (simplified) form flextable::separate_header argument.

title: rempsyc 0.0.6
text: New package site, hooray! Changed default method base cor function “na..complete” liberal one match SPSS: “pairwise.complete.obs”. Added use argument specify one use case user wants different option. Automatized integration report package don’t specify e.g. report = "lm" argument manually. Added optional arguments table title footnote. Changed sapply lapply since sapply recommended using vapply list outputs complicated. Shortened line codes < 80 characters. Replaced 1:length(…) 1:nrow(…) seq_along(…).

title: rempsyc 0.0.5
text: nice_violin: Corrected bug whereas Cohen’s d wasn’t added plot manual annotation (opposed automatic) comparisons made. Also, default test used geom_signif::geom_signif() Wilcox test. changed t-test avoid confusion results mismatch. Finally, contour lines made thicker since high resolution appeared thin. New function: format_d format d values e.g., 0.30 instead 0.3 e.g., violin plots.

Thus now cleaner missing variable names.
